channel.title: Audible Ajax
channel.itunes:author: Ben and Dion of Ajaxian.com
channel.itunes:subtitle: Cleaning up websites with Ajax
channel.itunes:summary: Ben and Dion of Ajaxian.com discuss issues around the new Web technology called Ajax (a.k.a. dhtml) and interview various Ajax notables.
channel.description: Ben and Dion of Ajaxian.com discuss issues around the new Web technology called Ajax (a.k.a. dhtml) and interview various Ajax notables.

item.title: Interview with Gavin Doughtie of Google - Audible Ajax Episode 29
item.itunes:author: Ben and Dion of Ajaxian.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Gavin Doughtie of Google - Audible Ajax Episode 29
item.itunes:summary: Dion and Ben interview Dojo contributor and Google employee Gavin Doughtie, discussing browser graphics and his talks at OSCON and The Ajax Experience.

item.title: Google Chrome, Chromium, V8 - Audible Ajax Episode 28
item.itunes:author: Ben and Dion of Ajaxian.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Google Chrome, Chromium, V8 - Audible Ajax Episode 28
item.itunes:summary: In this episode we discuss the launch of Google Chrome and Chromium, how this adds to the hopeful world of TraceMonkey, V8, and SquirrelFish. We also delve into Canvas land and the fun and frolics that are planned for The Ajax Experience in Boston that happens shortly.
item.description: In this episode we discuss the launch of Google Chrome and Chromium, how this adds to the hopeful world of TraceMonkey, V8, and SquirrelFish. We also delve into Canvas land and the fun and frolics that are planned for The Ajax Experience in Boston that happens shortly.
item.itunes:keywords: ajax ajaxian web web2.0 programming development javascript java ruby rails programming consulting training dion ben dionalmaer bengalbraith

item.title: SproutCore - Audible Ajax Episode 27
item.itunes:author: Ben and Dion of Ajaxian.com
item.itunes:subtitle: SproutCore - Audible Ajax Episode 27
item.itunes:summary: I sat down with Charles Jolley of Sproutit / SproutCore fame. Their has been a lot of SproutCore in the news, as it powers the new MobileMe from Apple, a very rich application built on the Open Web. Learn about the roots of the framework, how it is differ
item.description: I sat down with Charles Jolley of Sproutit / SproutCore fame. Their has been a lot of SproutCore in the news, as it powers the new MobileMe from Apple, a very rich application built on the Open Web. Learn about the roots of the framework, how it is differ

item.title: Audible Ajax Episode 26 - 260 North and Objective-J
item.itunes:author: Ben and Dion of Ajaxian.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Audible Ajax Episode 26 - 260 North and Objective-J
item.itunes:summary: We sat down the with 280 North team that just released 280 Slides, an application that people call "Keynote on the Web" due to its Apple/desktop-like look and feel. The app uses a framework that the guys created, Cappuccino that uses the Objective-J language and runtime to build great looking applications.
item.description: We sat down the with 280 North team that just released 280 Slides, an application that people call "Keynote on the Web" due to its Apple/desktop-like look and feel. The app uses a framework that the guys created, Cappuccino that uses the Objective-J language and runtime to build great looking applications.
item.itunes:keywords: ajax ajaxian web web2.0 programming development javascript java ruby rails programming consulting training dion ben dionalmaer bengalbraith

item.title: Audible Ajax Episode 25 - State of Ajax
item.itunes:author: Ben and Dion of Ajaxian.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Audible Ajax Episode 25 - State of Ajax
item.itunes:summary: Ajaxians get together to talk about the big news in the last month or so. We discuss IE 8, the state of standards, Acid3 testing, the Open Web, and more.
item.description: Ajaxians get together to talk about the big news in the last month or so. We discuss IE 8, the state of standards, Acid3 testing, the Open Web, and more.

item.title: Audible Ajax Episode 24 - Aptana Jaxer
item.itunes:author: Ben and Dion of Ajaxian.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Audible Ajax Episode 24 - Aptana Jaxer
item.itunes:summary: Ajaxians interview the gents of Aptana on their Jaxer server side Ajax framework that was recently released. They discuss the difference it makes when you have a full browser in the backend instead of just a JavaScript interpreter.
item.description: Ajaxians interview the gents of Aptana on their Jaxer server side Ajax framework that was recently released. They discuss the difference it makes when you have a full browser in the backend instead of just a JavaScript interpreter.
item.itunes:keywords: ajax ajaxian web web2.0 programming development javascript java ruby rails programming consulting training dion ben dionalmaer bengalbraith

item.title: Audible Ajax Episode 23 - Zed Shaw on Rails community, enterprise, Ajax, patents, and a whole lot more
item.itunes:author: Ben and Dion of Ajaxian.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Audible Ajax Episode 23 - Zed Shaw on Rails community, enterprise, Ajax, patents, and a whole lot more
item.itunes:summary: Ajaxians interview Zed Shaw covering his thoughts on the Rails community, the role of the Enterprise, the state of Ajax, JRuby and Rubinius, documentation, tests, tooling, the role of patents in software, and a whole lot of opinion.
item.description: Ajaxians interview Zed Shaw covering his thoughts on the Rails community, the role of the Enterprise, the state of Ajax, JRuby and Rubinius, documentation, tests, tooling, the role of patents in software, and a whole lot of opinion.

item.title: Ajaxians March State of Ajax and hear from Jamis Buck from 37 Signals
item.itunes:author: Ben and Dion of Ajaxian.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Ajaxians March State of Ajax and hear from Jamis Buck from 37 Signals
item.itunes:summary: In our 16th show, we discuss what is going on in the world of Ajax in March 2006. We discuss questions from the community regarding polling in Ajax frameworks, as well as commentary and features announced over the last couple of weeks.

item.itunes:subtitle: Ajaxians go over the first state of Ajax in 2006 from Denmark
item.itunes:summary: In our 14th show, we got together in Denmark to discuss what is going on in the world of Ajax in 2006. We discuss questions from the community on Ajax frameworks, as well as cool commentary and features announced over the new year.
